Issues.Title: Angular Contributors page focus lost after clicking on a card
Issues.Body:
### Description

Angular Contributors page using a pattern where cards are displayed which flip over when clicking on them. this creates a11y problems because focus is lost when flipping the card. Also, this is explicitly not allowed in the material design spec.

### What is the affected URL?

https://angular.io/about?group=Angular

### Please provide the steps to reproduce the issue

1. navigate to https://angular.io/about?group=Angular
2. press tab until focused on "Alan Agius" card
3. press space
4 (Alan's card flips over)
5. press space again
6. browser scrolls down on the page

### Please provide the expected behavior vs the actual behavior you encountered

this pattern of having cards that flip should not be used at all. Focus show not be lost after clicking on a card.

### Please provide a screenshot if possible

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Is this a browser-specific issue? If so, please specify the device, browser, and version.

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Contributors page focus lost after clicking on a card" (#44346)

Issues.Title: aio-notification close button needs a more specific accessible label
Issues.Body:
The close button for `<aio-notification>` only reads "Close" without additional context. For assistive technology users, it's not clear _what_ is being closed. While adding some additional label content would help this, it would probably also help to make the whole component something like `role="group"` to communicate the whole notification is one "thing". 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/838736/144332175-9a5f4607-c6b8-4a1d-ac9f-a21222f255ab.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "aio-notification close button needs a more specific accessible label" (#44345)

Issues.Title: Accessibility issues for aio table of contents widget
Issues.Body:
The table of contents (TOC) widget has a few accessibility issues:
- [ ] The TOC appears in the DOM _after_ the content. Assistive technology users won't even know that the TOC exists at all until they've read through the entire document. 
- [ ] When you click on an anchor in the TOC, it scrolls the corresponding content into view, but it doesn't move focus to that content.
- [ ] Each `li` in the TOC specifies a `title` that mirrors the anchor text, which causes some screen readers to announce the content twice
- [ ] For small screen sizes, the table of contents automatically collapses, showing a button to expand:
    - [ ] The main expand/collapse button is at the bottom of the expandable content, meaning that users would have to navigate to it, and then navigate _backwards_ through the TOC to get to the top of it
    - [ ] There's a secondary collapse-only button at the top of the TOC when it's expanded. Clicking this button drops focus back to the document body. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/838736/144330474-b19d7a0a-6667-4cb7-8485-fcd85f8a760b.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/838736/144332908-4d29f28e-6256-4e96-bbae-e7e1a8795c19.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility issues for aio table of contents widget" (#44343)

Issues.Title: "Docs menu" button on aio homepage is interactable, but not visible
Issues.Body:
On larger viewport sizes, the "Docs menu" button is hidden. However, the button is still interactable in the DOM. The result is that assistive technology will land on this button, but the navigation cursor indicator will be a tiny rectangle in the top right corner of the screen. In general, if something is interactable, it should take up some space on the screen. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/838736/144329632-48b399e9-1709-44ea-98dd-7d2f51f104dd.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ""Docs menu" button on aio homepage is interactable, but not visible " (#44342)

Issues.Title: Accessibility issues with version picker
Issues.Body:
I've observed a few different accessibility issues with the version picker
- [ ] The button's label is the currently selected version (by default e.g. "stable v13.0.03"). The label should instead convey what the button _does_ rather than a selected value. In this case, what the button does is toggle the version selection options
- [ ] After clicking the current version, focus remains on that button even though that button is "hidden" by the list of options that appear. This should really move focus to the list of options. 
- [ ] The options themselves are inside of a `<ul>` (good), but each `<li>` has its role overridden with `role="button`, which creates an invalid structure (`<ul>` must contain only list items). 
- [ ] The buttons that navigate to different versions should probably be anchors because they navigate to another URL

Overall, this whole interaction should probably be rethought, potentially just using a menu component.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility issues with version picker" (#44339)

Issues.Title: Multiple rendering issues for aio in Windows high contrast mode
Issues.Body:
I've observed the following issues for aio in Windows High Contrast Mode

- [ ] The main header navigation links (Docs, Resources, etc) do not have a focus treatment
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/838736/144323055-2870c4bc-f820-4028-ba24-bb8641b57baa.png)

- [ ] The search text input does not have a border
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/838736/144323245-e5011c67-f9a6-4ec1-87a5-877d1df600b2.png)


- [ ] The copy button for code snippets/examples does not have a border (this should probably be a `mat-icon-button`)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/838736/144323563-4aac4d6d-48af-4e7a-8f75-a45a18dae08c.png)

- [ ] The position indicator in the table of contents is almost impossible to see
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/838736/144324176-e1b95775-f888-4c42-ba52-f30262521601.png)

- [ ] The "Suggest edits" icon doesn't have a border (this should also probably be a `mat-icon-button`)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/838736/144324426-ab04ce8a-54d4-4e8a-87bd-e61212ac7197.png)

- [ ] There's no separator between an example file header and its content
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/838736/144324551-3beface0-b7f1-4b17-acb0-5b299b16524f.png)

#### Breaking 💥

The tool used `v1.1` tunnels REST API endpoint `/available_tunnels` to get all the tunnels for the user and their org. The endpoint is a part of API version that Sauce Labs is planning to deprecate in the future.

To get the same information with this and upcoming releases, use v1 tunnels REST API endpoint `/tunnels?all=true&full=true` to get all the tunnels for the user and their org. The endpoint is a part of the supported API version.

```js
const availableTunnels = await api.listTunnels(username, { all: true, full: true })
```

-   Resolves [#​119](https://togithub.com/saucelabs/node-saucelabs/issues/119) ([#​120](https://togithub.com/saucelabs/node-saucelabs/issues/120)) ([`da447ef`](https://togithub.com/saucelabs/node-saucelabs/commit/da447ef))

Issues.Title: fix(common): stricter type for http methods
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe: 


## What is the current behavior?
It's currently possible to use any string as the HTTP method.
As discussed with Pete and @AndrewKushnir it could be interesting to have a more strictly typed API,
and only allow valid HTTP methods (both in lowercase and uppercase to preserve the existing behavior)

## What is the new behavior?

This commit tightens the API to only accept one of the possible HTTP verb, either in lowercase or in uppercase (to preserve the existing behavior).

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [x] Yes
- [ ] No

The HTTP method must now be one of `'GET'|'HEAD'|'POST'|'PUT'|'DELETE'|'CONNECT'|'OPTIONS'|'TRACE'|'PATCH'|'JSONP'` (or one of these in lowercase) instead of a `string`. This helps developers to catch possible typos like `http.request('POTS', ...)`, but can result in compilation errors when updating if you have such typos in your code. In the rare cases where developers used a temporary string variable to store the method, the type of this variable must be updated to be a string literal, for example `const method = 'GET' as const`.


## Other information
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(common): stricter type for http methods" (#44328)

Issues.Title: Library built with ng12 does not work in app built with ng13 via platformBrowserDynamic().bootstrapModule();
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

If a library is built using Angular 12 (via `ng-packagr` in  case it is relevant) and then loaded in an Angular 13 application using `platformBrowserDynamic().bootstrapModule()` the library doesn't compile because it's missing the `'ɵmod'` property.

If the library is built using ng13, it works in both ng12 and ng13 apps.

I found this problem when upgrading the ui-router Angular+AngularJS hybrid library.  To mitigate, I rebuilt the libraries using ng13.



### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/ui-router/angular-hybrid/tree/ng12-library-in-ng13

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Uncaught Error: Type Ng12LibModule does not have 'ɵmod' property.
    at getNgModuleDef (app.js:83458)
    at recurse (app.js:104438)
    at recurse (app.js:104449)
    at registerNgModuleType (app.js:104434)
    at new NgModuleFactory (app.js:104560)
    at compileNgModuleFactory__POST_R3__ (app.js:108603)
    at PlatformRef.bootstrapModule (app.js:108856)
    at Object../src/app.ts (app.js:3679)
    at __webpack_require__ (app.js:118204)
    at app.js:119272
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
app: Angular 13.0.2 (non-cli webpack build)
lib: Angular 12.2.13
```


### Anything else?

To reproduce the problem:

```shell
git clone https://github.com/ui-router/angular-hybrid -b ng12-library-in-ng13 ng12-library-in-ng13; 
cd ng12-library-in-ng13; 
./run.sh
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Library built with ng12 does not work in app built with ng13 via platformBrowserDynamic().bootstrapModule();" (#44323)

Issues.Title: JSON Schema for tsconfig.app.json or tsconfig.json
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/releated to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

It would be nice if I could specify a `$schema` for the `tsconfig.app.json` (or `tsconfig.json` depending on your setup) provided by the Angular package. This would give us autocompletion, inline documentation via the `description` field and type validation for each parameter, especially important for `angularCompilerOptions`.

### Proposed solution

A `schema.json` file inside the `@angular` package that can be set as `$schema` for the `tsconfig.app.json`, as is already the case for the `angular.json`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "JSON Schema for tsconfig.app.json or tsconfig.json" (#44327)

Issues.Title: refactor(forms): Move FormControl to an overridden constructor.
Issues.Body:
This implementation change was originally proposed as part of Typed Forms, and will have major consequences for that project as described in the design doc. In summary, this change causes the constructor for `FormControl` to be decoupled from its implementation. This will allow us to provide multiple constructor signatures in the future, and even to return `FormControl<T>` where `T` takes different values depending on the constructor signature selected.

Submitting this change separately is desirable for a few reasons:
- It reduces the risk of landing Typed Forms -- the constructor override is complicated, and is fundamentally separate from the core types.
- It enables us to submit a follow-up change for default values before Typed Forms lands, thus separating the only runtime behavior change from all the types-only changes.

This change should have no visible impact on users of `FormControl`.

See the Typed Forms design doc here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1cWuBE-oo5WLtwkLFxbNTiaVQGNk8ipgbekZcKBeyxxo.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): correctly extract messages when using cached build
Issues.Body:
Extracted messages are not part of Webpack pipeline and hence they cannot be retrieved from cache. Therefore, we need to mark the extraction loader as non cacheable.

Closes #22264

Issues.Title: Angular 13: 'ng serve' does not proxy multiple websocket connections correctly and results in 'Invalid frame header' errors
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 12.2.5 ### Description When the dev server is configured to proxy websockets, connections are rejected with 'Invalid frame header' ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Establish a valid proxy configuration that includes multiple websocket URLs. Observe the behaviour in the Chrome devtools tab. Expected behavior: websocket connections are established correctly Actual behavior: Some websocket connections fail with 'Invalid frame header' I have verified that direct connections to the websocket URL (bypassing the proxy altogether) work correctly. ## 🔥 Exception or Error "Invalid frame header" errors are observed in Chrome devtools / network tab ## 🌍 Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 13.0.3
Node: 16.13.0
Package Manager: npm 8.1.0
OS: win32 x64
**Anything else relevant?** Angular 12 used http-proxy-middleware v 0.19.1 Angular 13 uses http-proxy-middleware 2.0.1 This issue in http-proxy-middleware might be the root cause of the problem: https://github.com/chimurai/http-proxy-middleware/issues/463 There is a noted workaround that might be possible to include in the dev server. Our workaround, in the interim, is to bypass the proxy for websocket connections.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular 13: 'ng serve' does not proxy multiple websocket connections correctly and results in 'Invalid frame header' errors" (#22260)

Issues.Title: fix(@ngtools/webpack): handle promise rejection during Angular program analyzes
Issues.Body:
Currently, when `analyzeAsync` promise is rejected, the build fails with an `UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning`.

Example:
```
(node:69086) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: Cannot use a JavaScript or TypeScript file (/Users/error-testing/src/app/app.component.ts) in a component's styleUrls or templateUrl.
    at WebpackResourceLoader._compile (/Users/error-testing/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/resource_loader.js:107:19)
    at WebpackResourceLoader.get (/Users/error-testing/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/resource_loader.js:266:44)
    at Object.resourceHost.readResource (/Users/error-testing/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/ivy/host.js:48:35)
    at AdapterResourceLoader.preload (file:///Users/error-testing/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/bundles/index.js:12177:31)
    at resolveStyleUrl (file:///Users/error-testing/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/bundles/index.js:9593:36)
    at file:///Users/error-testing/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/bundles/index.js:9621:47
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at ComponentDecoratorHandler.preanalyze (file:///Users/error-testing/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/bundles/index.js:9621:29)
    at TraitCompiler.analyzeClass (file:///Users/error-testing/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/bundles/index.js:6647:39)
    at visit2 (file:///Users/error-testing/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/bundles/index.js:6494:14)
```

With this change we handle such error and also hide stacktraces
```
./src/app/app.module.ts - Error: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/ivy/index.js):
Error: Cannot use a JavaScript or TypeScript file (/Users/error-testing/src/app/app.component.ts) in a component's styleUrls or templateUrl.
    at /Users/error-testing/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/ivy/loader.js:75:34
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:95:5)
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@ngtools/webpack): handle promise rejection during Angular program analyzes" (#22265)

Issues.Title: Offer mechanism for font inline optimization that doesn't involve putting the font in index.html
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/releated to the feature request?

compiler-cli

### Description

Currently to benefit from the font inlining optimization  an angular application must:

1. be using a font from the url https://fonts.gstatic.com or https://use.typekit.net
2. have this font url located in the index.html file in a `<link>` tag 

This is unusual because the index.html file is unlikely to be supported by unit tests. Also if for some reason you need to make a customization for a particular build configuration your options are seemingly to either bundle a different named file as the "index" member in the build configuration, or replace the file in a pre-build step outside of angular-cli. Both of these options mean you must have a different index.html file somewhere that is also unlikely to be supported by tests.

### Proposed solution

In angular.json it would be nice to define font css stylesheets; either something like:

```json
      "architect": {
        "build": {
          "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
          "options": {
            "fonts": ["https://use.typekit.net/abcdef.css"],
```

or  perhaps simply:


```json
      "architect": {
        "build": {
          "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
          "options": {
            "styles": ["https://use.typekit.net/abcdef.css", "src/styles.scss"],
```

### Alternatives considered

* require an internet connection for local development with open access to font apis not being blocked
* tell licensees that the font needs to be available on a number of additional dynamic urls for development purposes
* give up and put a unique index.html file for each build configuration
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Offer mechanism for font inline optimization that doesn't involve putting the font in index.html" (#22259)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/compare/v3.19.1...v3.19.2)

-   Added a workaround for a UC Browser specific version bug with unobservable `RegExp#sticky` flag, [#​1008](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/1008), [#​1015](https://togithub.com/zloirock/core-js/issues/1015)

<details>
<summary>evanw/esbuild</summary>

### [`v0.14.1`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​0141)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.14.0...v0.14.1)

-   Fix `imports` in `package.json` ([#​1807](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/1807))

    This release contains a fix for the rarely-used [`imports` feature in `package.json` files](https://nodejs.org/api/packages.html#subpath-imports) that lets a package specify a custom remapping for import paths inside that package that start with `#`. Support for `imports` was added in version 0.13.9. However, the field was being incorrectly interpreted as relative to the importing file instead of to the `package.json` file, which caused an import failure when the importing file is in a subdirectory instead of being at the top level of the package. Import paths should now be interpreted as relative to the correct directory which should fix these path resolution failures.

-   Isolate implicit sibling scope lookup for `enum` and `namespace`

    The previous release implemented sibling namespaces in TypeScript, which introduces a new kind of scope lookup that doesn't exist in JavaScript. Exported members inside an `enum` or `namespace` block can be implicitly referenced in a sibling `enum` or `namespace` block just by using the name without using a property reference. However, this behavior appears to only work for `enum`-to-`enum` and `namespace`-to-`namespace` interactions. Even though sibling enums and namespaces with the same name can be merged together into the same underlying object, this implicit reference behavior doesn't work for `enum`-to-`namespace` interactions and attempting to do this with a `namespace`-to-`enum` interaction [causes the TypeScript compiler itself to crash](https://togithub.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/46891). Here is an example of how the TypeScript compiler behaves in each case:

    ```ts
    // "b" is accessible
    enum a { b = 1 }
    enum a { c = b }

    // "e" is accessible
    namespace d { export let e = 1 }
    namespace d { export let f = e }

    // "h" is inaccessible
    enum g { h = 1 }
    namespace g { export let i = h }

    // This causes the TypeScript compiler to crash
    namespace j { export let k = 1 }
    enum j { l = k }
    ```

    This release changes the implicit sibling scope lookup behavior to only work for `enum`-to-`enum` and `namespace`-to-`namespace` interactions. These implicit references no longer work with `enum`-to-`namespace` and `namespace`-to-`enum` interactions, which should more accurately match the behavior of the TypeScript compiler.

-   Add semicolon insertion before TypeScript-specific definite assignment assertion modifier ([#​1810](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/1810))

    TypeScript lets you add a `!` after a variable declaration to bypass TypeScript's definite assignment analysis:

    ```ts
    let x!: number[];
    initialize();
    x.push(4);

    function initialize() { x = [0, 1, 2, 3]; }
    ```

    This `!` is called a [definite assignment assertion](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-2-7/#definite-assignment-assertions) and tells TypeScript to assume that the variable has been initialized somehow. However, JavaScript's automatic semicolon insertion rules should be able to insert a semicolon before it:

    ```ts
    let a
    !function(){}()
    ```

    Previously the above code was incorrectly considered a syntax error in TypeScript. With this release, this code is now parsed correctly.

-   Log output to stderr has been overhauled

    This release changes the way log messages are formatted to stderr. The changes make the kind of message (e.g. error vs. warning vs. note) more obvious, and they also give more room for paragraph-style notes that can provide more detail about the message. Here's an example:

    Before:

         > example.tsx:14:25: warning: Comparison with -0 using the "===" operator will also match 0
            14 │     case 1: return x === -0
               ╵                          ~~
         > example.tsx:21:23: error: Could not resolve "path" (use "--platform=node" when building for node)
            21 │   const path = require('path')
               ╵                        ~~~~~~

    After:

        ▲ [WARNING] Comparison with -0 using the "===" operator will also match 0

            example.tsx:14:25:
              14 │     case 1: return x === -0
                 ╵                          ~~

          Floating-point equality is defined such that 0 and -0 are equal, so "x === -0" returns true for
          both 0 and -0. You need to use "Object.is(x, -0)" instead to test for -0.

        ✘ [ERROR] Could not resolve "path"

            example.tsx:21:23:
              21 │   const path = require('path')
                 ╵                        ~~~~~~

          The package "path" wasn't found on the file system but is built into node. Are you trying to
          bundle for node? You can use "--platform=node" to do that, which will remove this error.

    Note that esbuild's formatted log output is for humans, not for machines. If you need to output a stable machine-readable format, you should be using the API for that. Build and transform results have arrays called `errors` and `warnings` with objects that represent the log messages.

-   Show inlined enum value names in comments

    When esbuild inlines an enum, it will now put a comment next to it with the original enum name:

    ```ts
    // Original code
    const enum Foo { FOO }
    console.log(Foo.FOO)

    // Old output
    console.log(0);

    // New output
    console.log(0 /* FOO */);
    ```

    This matches the behavior of the TypeScript compiler, and should help with debugging. These comments are not generated if minification is enabled.

</details>

Issues.Title: Use `asset modules` and `resourceQuery`
Issues.Body:
**refactor(@ngtools/webpack): remove direct angular resource loader** 
We remove the custom direct resource loader which is used for JIT when `directTemplateLoading` is enabled. Instead, use Webpack's [asset modules](https://webpack.js.org/guides/asset-modules/) which were introduced in version 5.

To the resource URL, we also add a query parameter, `ngResource`. This is used to be filter request based on a query. See https://webpack.js.org/guides/asset-modules/#replacing-inline-loader-syntax for more information.


**fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): differentiate components and global styles using file query instead of filename.**
Previously, we introduced the `ngResource` query to Angular component resources we now use it with `resourceQuery` to differentiate between global and components styles, since in some cases while unlikely a file can be used as a component and global style.

Closes #7245
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Use `asset modules` and `resourceQuery`" (#22252)

Issues.Title: Automatic inlining of fonts results in jagged fonts for Windows users
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, automatic inlining of fonts was introduced in Angular 11 (defaulted to on) ### Description Some Google fonts are rendering poorly for Windows users when automatic font inlining is turned on ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction Start up a new angular project, and add google open sans font into your `index.html` like so: ``` ``` Set the font-family of text to 'Open Sans' and font size to 12px. Build the project so that the font inlining happens, and serve the static bundle locally. One quick example to do this is to run `npx http-server dist/{PROJECT_NAME_HERE}` Notice that the rendered fonts look jagged and poor aliased. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3110057/143935224-75140edc-9af1-420a-bd88-f0e2e648a010.png) If I turn off font-inlining and rebuild the font renders better: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3110057/143935763-b05dec15-d334-46c4-8654-238d4ac9d636.png) ## 🌍 Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 12.2.13
Node: 15.3.0 (Unsupported)
Package Manager: npm 7.0.14
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 12.2.13
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1202.13

@angular-devkit/core            12.2.13
@angular-devkit/schematics      12.2.13
@schematics/angular             12.2.13
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.3.5
**Anything else relevant?** [Looking at how the build-time font inlining works](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/7ff8c5350ea2e49574dd659adae02215957d2685/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/utils/index-file/inline-fonts.ts#L185), it's making a request at build time with a Mac OSX user-agent which returns a different set of fonts than if I hit the Google Fonts endpoint with a Windows user-agent. In my testing when I replaced the inlined styles with fonts inlined with a Windows user agent the fonts rendered fine.

Closes #21588

Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

Currently the example docs rely on a single use case where the user interacts with the map and a (mapClick) event grabs the map instance and passes it back to a component.ts function.   If a developer wishes to decorate a map with a marker or an info window before a user interacts with it, there is no map reference to use.

It appears that standard @ViewChild methods for obtaining a dom reference do not work with the angular google-maps component.   We could use a good example of how to get the map reference.

https://github.com/angular/components/tree/master/src/google-maps/map-marker

Issues.Title: feat(drag drop): add cdkDragReady event
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

I see a need for adding an event that would signal drag readiness, ie. be fired **after** the `cdkDragStartDelay` elapse, regardless of whether the subsequent `cdkDragStart` occurs or not.

Let's call it `cdkDragReady`.

When introduced,`cdkDragReleased` should also be fired on touchup/mouseup where the `cdkDragStart` has not occurred (user released before making a move).

### Use Case

Especially on mobile, scenarios involving vertically long, scrollable containers with drag-and-drop enabled elements need `[cdkDragStartDelay]` in place in order to guard user against accidental drag-and-drop. In this scenarios you'd want to let user know when the drag readiness actually starts. 

The event at hand would allow to signal drag readiness either visually (adding a class to an element) or through a haptic feedback on mobile.

```html
<my-comp
  [cdkDragStartDelay]="200"
  (cdkDragReady)="handleDragReady($event)"
  (cdkDragReleased)="handleDragReleased($event)"
></my-comp>
```

```ts
export class MyComp {
  handleDragReady($event: CdkDragReady){
    window.navigator.vibrate(15); // mobile haptic feedback
    $event.source.element.nativeElement.classList.add('my-comp-drag-ready'); // highlight the drag source container
  }

  handleDragReleased($event: CdkDragRelease){ // fired even when no drag occurred
    $event.source.element.nativeElement.classList.remove('my-comp-drag-ready'); // unhighlight the drag source container
  }
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(drag drop): add cdkDragReady event " (#24035)

Issues.Title: ng-update: consult workspace configuration for determining global stylesheets
Issues.Body:
This is a port of COMP-280 and for just for tracking at this point!

Currently, ng-update always finds global/external stylesheets that need to be migrated by simply
querying for `.css` or `.scss` files in the workspace tree.

This is not ideal since it can mean that non-project files are accidentally migrated. Ideally, we'd just
consult the `angular.json` file to look for `styles`. This makes the logic more future-proof (and avoids issues as in: #18434).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng-update: consult workspace configuration for determining global stylesheets" (#24032)

Issues.Title: bug(ripple): Ripple overflows element in Safari when using ShadowDOM
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Then clicking on an interactive element like the Material Button or a Selection List, a ripple affect appears inside the element.

The ripple elements sometimes overflows the element and is visible on the whole page, when using Shadow DOM (ViewEncapsulation) and Safari.

### Reproduction

I was not able to reproduce the issue in the integrated view of StackBlitz and "Open external window" feature of StackBlitz does not work at all in Safari.

The problem can be reproduced in this project: https://github.com/rothsandro/ng-ripple-issue
Deployment: https://quirky-euclid-0e87f5.netlify.app

It's a new Angular 13 project, created with the Angular CLI. I added Angular Material with the official `ng` command and imported  the Angular Modules. I moved the Material Theme import from `angular.json` into the SCSS file of the component and added `encapsulation: ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDOM`.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Clone the repo: git@github.com:rothsandro/ng-ripple-issue.git
2. Move into the directory and install all deps: `cd ng-ripple-issue && npm i`
3. Start the project: `npm start`
4. Open `localhost:4200/` in Safari
5. Click on the list selection items and the button

The problem does not occur without Shadow DOM. When I change the encapsulation to `None` the issue is gone. The problem cannot be reproduced in Brave.

### Expected Behavior

The ripple effect should only be visible inside the selection item and inside the button.

### Actual Behavior

The effect is visible over the whole page sometimes. The problem does not always occur but can be reproduced very often.

Here is how it looks like:
![ripple-effect](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16229645/143835127-cd523383-aa71-42c8-a0a9-be766c46a3ca.gif)


### Environment

```
Angular CLI: 13.0.3
Node: 16.13.0
Package Manager: npm 8.1.0
OS: darwin arm64

... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

```

Issues.Title: bug(material-date-fns-adapter): Wrong option for format method
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

date-fns [format()](https://date-fns.org/v2.26.0/docs/format) method requires that the `options` object `locale` property is a [Locale](https://date-fns.org/v2.26.0/docs/Locale) object.

But currently in the adapter implementation a string is passed:
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/39921f43382e3abc90c14fd8602d0cf371239fce/src/material-date-fns-adapter/adapter/date-fns-adapter.ts#L193

```
  format(date: Date, displayFormat: string): string {
    if (!this.isValid(date)) {
      throw Error('DateFnsAdapter: Cannot format invalid date.');
    }

    return format(date, displayFormat, {locale: this.locale});
  }
```
`this.locale` is set in the contstructor from MAT_DATE_LOCALE
https://github.com/angular/components/blob/39921f43382e3abc90c14fd8602d0cf371239fce/src/material-date-fns-adapter/adapter/date-fns-adapter.ts#L55

This causes an error:
```
 RangeError: locale must contain localize property

      at format (../../node_modules/date-fns/format/index.js:382:11)
      at DateFnsAdapter.format (../../node_modules/@angular/material-date-fns-adapter/fesm2020/material-date-fns-adapter.mjs:145:16)
      at MatDatepickerInput._formatValue (../../node_modules/@angular/material/fesm2015/datepicker.mjs:2721:33)

```

The fix should be similar to how it is solved here:
https://www.npmjs.com/package/ngx-mat-datefns-date-adapter

Where you provide the DateFns locales in a token and then get the correct one in the adabter based on the MAT_DATE_LOCALE value?

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
Using
"@angular/material-date-fns-adapter": "^13.0.2"
"@angular/material": "13.0.2",

in NgModule use:
```
{
            provide: DateAdapter,
            useClass: DateFnsAdapter,
            deps: [MAT_DATE_LOCALE],
        }
```

### Expected Behavior

No error is thrown.

### Actual Behavior

Error is thrown.

### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material:

Issues.Title: docs(material): examples in jsdocs
Issues.Body: ### Feature Description Currently the jsdocs on components is very minimal, with very little detail https://github.com/angular/components/blob/39921f43382e3abc90c14fd8602d0cf371239fce/src/material/button/button.ts#L62-L64 Example how how this displays in VS Code With `material-experiential` things seem greatly improved https://github.com/angular/components/blob/39921f43382e3abc90c14fd8602d0cf371239fce/src/material-experimental/mdc-button/button.ts#L30-L38 But I think there is still a few things missing. There is a link to the material design docs which is great, but it would be awesome to have a link to the Angular Material documentation which has code examples and live demos. Additionally it would be cool to have code examples in the JSDocs themselves. This helps with discoverability of different ways of using components, for example showing the `mat-flat-button` as an example would be quite useful on the `mat-button` JSDoc ### Use Case Having faster access to documentation will not only help new developers who are not familiar with all the APIs that `@angular/material` has to offer, but also help refresh the memory of any developers who works in many context, such as backend work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs(material): examples in jsdocs" (#24024)

Issues.Title: help(map-directions-renderer): How can I modify the PolylinesOptions of Angular Components map-Directions-renderer?
Issues.Body:
### What are you trying to do?


hi I'm trying to edit the PolylinesOptions of the `<map-directions-renderer>`  component and I can't get results

I need to generate multiple renderers to generate different paths independent of each other, with these PolylinesOptios is to generate a custom line to identify the routes from each other. [( Live Example )](http://jsfiddle.net/p5gmyd0z/5/)

>**_Expected result_**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55502763/143517531-5fda5ef7-6646-4ec1-9ddd-d2256a69ba78.png)


>**_Obtained result_**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55502763/143517458-efca20de-f801-47f0-b5de-195d5fe19a52.png)


that's why all renderers are bound to the same variable

```typescript
@ViewChildren('directionsRender') directionsRenders : QueryList<ElementRef<google.maps.DirectionsRenderer> >;
```
```typescript
  this.directionsRenderOption = {
    draggable:false,
    suppressInfoWindows:true,
    markerOptions:{
      draggable: false,
      clickable:false,
    };,
    polylineOptions:{
      strokeColor: '#9966ff',
      strokeOpacity: 0,
      icons: [{
        icon: {
          path: google.maps.SymbolPath.CIRCLE,
          fillOpacity: 1,
          scale: 3
        },
      offset: '0',
      repeat: '1px'
      }],
    }
  }`
```
```html
<google-map
        #map 
        height="100%" 
        width="null" 
        [options]="this.mapOptions"
        (tilesloaded)="tilesLoaded()"
        *ngIf="this.itemList.length != 0"
    >
        <map-directions-renderer 
            #directionsRender 
            *ngFor="let directionResult of directionsResults"
            [options]="directionsRenderOption" 
            [directions]="directionResult" 
        >
        </map-directions-renderer>
    </google-map>
```

### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

I already tried to insert the options through a QueryList from a @ViewChildren and all the nativeElements return undefined in their methods but if they return the ElementRef from the Dom

it only happens with the PolylineOption, since if I modify for example the options of the markers if it applies these properties, Example: Modify the MarkerOptions of the rendering options to draggable, if you apply the changes

> **_Results ( Marker A )_**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55502763/143518193-e4f69ad8-9c19-4042-b4fc-356a4192e2ed.png)


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. insert PolylineOptions in this component
2. rendered component


### Environment

- Angular: 12.1.4
- CDK/Material: @angular/google-maps
- Browser(s): All
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubunt): All
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "help(map-directions-renderer): How can I modify the PolylinesOptions of Angular Components map-Directions-renderer?" (#24016)
